message: Guys I would love to hear your opinion/experience on a problem I have been researching which is how Uber/Careem update the driver location like real time. The only obvious way I can think of that the drivers devices send their location each small interval of time like 2~5 seconds, but I know that there is a limit on the number of free requests by google. What is the best way to handle this? Is the only way to pay google for the extra requests :)? Would love to hear your experience on that.

Drivers have their own application which is always running in the foreground. The Location libraries in Android allows you to listen and be notified of location changes through a function called onLocationUpdate or something similar. My guess is when the driver location changes the app sends it to Uber servers.
I don't think it is related to Google or Google Maps API. It should be purely based on Android or iOS.

Do you need Google APIs for something like Geo-Reversal (getting the address from lat/lon) or calculating routes between two points? I think this is where you could potentially need Google APIs - and there are many other providers of same service.
i'm working with London Cab Egypt we use google services for business [paid service]

Google has nothing to do with this, the device (meaning the phone) itself is capable of determining the current coordinations, that's what the GPS does, that's totally free if you want to implement something like it, sure you can.
on the other hand they are paying Google for using the visual map and the driving direction services, but they still and you can use any alternative service (ex: openstreetmap) or even implement you own.
